summary.text: A lens for a camera, which handles the projection.
Get the projection matrix for this lens.

This class provides functionalities for cameras.
You can choose which type of projection to use with the lens.
The type of lens this camera uses
The lens to use for this camera
The view matrix for this camera
The view projection matrix for this camera
Compute camera world matrix and update camera view matrix.
If true, the camera's parent's world matrix will not be computed

Compute a model view projection matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view projection matrix, and return the result.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to clip space.

**Note :** This method returns a local matrix variable, so you should not store it for later use.

Compute a model view matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view matrix.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to camera space.

Compute a model view projection matrix from a transform matrix using the camera view projection matrix.

You can use this to convert a matrix from world space to clip space.

Reverse project a point using the camera view projection matrix.

You can use this to transform a point from screen space to world space.
Create a camera with an orthographic lens.
Create a camera with a perspective lens.
The type of lens this camera uses
This class provides functionalities for orthographic projection.
The projection matrix for this lens
Whether the projection matrix is valid or not
Get the aspect ratio of this lens.
Set the aspect ratio of this lens.
Get the far plane distance of this lens.
Set the far plane distance of this lens.
Get the near plane distance of this lens.
Set the near plane distance of this lens.

Get the projection matrix for this lens.
The projection matrix is updated before (if it was declared invalid).
Set the bounds of this lens.
This class provides functionalities for perspective projection.
The mode of field of view (vertical, horizontal or auto)
The projection matrix for this lens
Whether the projection matrix is valid or not
Get the aspect ratio of this lens.
Set the aspect ratio of this lens.
Get the far plane distance of this lens.
Set the far plane distance of this lens.

Get the field of view set for this lens.
It can be the vertical or horizontal fov depending on the fov mode.
Get the near plane distance of this lens.
Set the near plane distance of this lens.
Get the computed horizontal field of view of this lens.

Get the projection matrix for this lens.
The projection matrix is updated before (if it was declared invalid).
Get the computed vertical field of view of this lens.

Set the field of view of this lens.
The value will be used for either the vertical or horizontal fov depending on the aspect ratio.
The fov mode will be changed to auto.

Set the horizontal field of view of this lens.
The fov mode will be changed to horizontal.

Set the vertical field of view of this lens.
The fov mode will be changed to vertical.
